coreCitation.title: LMEC Historic Boston Shoreline
coreCitation.briefDescription: Boundaries of historic shoreline; geography covers the City of Boston and parts of Cambridge, Somerville, Chelsea and Winthrop; time period covers 1630-present in a series of temporal snapshots
coreCitation.fullNotes: This dataset is organized into multiple features, each feature depicting the state of the Boston shoreline, at various snapshots in time: 1630, 1795, 1852, 1880, 1916, 1934, 1950 and 1995. The dataset will need to be filtered (right-click layer â†’ filter in QGIS) to display each historic year's shoreline. This data is made available as two separate layers, land and water, which are a direct inverse representation of one another.
coreCitation.briefGenealogy: This data was derived from the original MapWorks files. Vickie Taylor, as part of the Atlas of Boston History project, used the born-digital maps created from the original MapWorks data to re-digitize the historic shoreline features. No information is available about how the original MapWorks data was created.
coreCitation.accessCondition: This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

dataEndpoints.title: Boston Historic Shoreline Land Extent GeoJSON
Boston Historic Shoreline Water Extent GeoJSON

temporal.temporalNotes: This data represents the historic state of the Boston shoreline in the year 1995. It was digitally derived in 2019 from born-digital maps published in 1995.

publishedWorks.title: All Over the Map: How Boston Made Itself Bigger
publishedWorks.author: Betsy Mason

ingredients.notes: This source data, which contained separate files for each year, was consolidated and cleaned up into singular land and water files

maintenance.maintenanceFrequency: This dataset is not frequently updated
